channel.title: BBC Sport
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Lockyer returns to football with Bristol Rovers deal
item.description: Bristol Rovers sign Wales defender Tom Lockyer on a one-year contract almost two years after he suffered a cardiac arrest during a game.

item.title: Week of the wonderkids - who shone in Champions League?
item.description: BBC Sport looks at the emerging wonderkids that announced themselves as Europe's brightest stars in the Champions League this week.

item.title: Liverpool held meeting after Man Utd loss - Van Dijk
item.description: Liverpool captain Virgil van Dijk says he called a squad meeting on Monday to discuss the club's poor form - but insisted it was not a "crisis" summit.

item.title: Liverpool thrash Frankfurt to end losing run
item.description: Hugo Ekitike scores against his old club as Liverpool come from behind to hammer Eintracht Frankfurt 5-1 in the Champions League and end their four-match losing run.

item.title: Three teenagers score as Chelsea thump 10-man Ajax
item.description: Chelsea become the first team in Champions League history to have three teenage scorers as they secure a 5-1 win over a woeful Ajax side at Stamford Bridge.

item.title: BBC Women's Footballer of the Year contender Hannah Hampton
item.description: Meet Chelsea and England goalkeeper Hannah Hampton, who has been nominated for BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2025.

item.title: Standout performance from Vicario earns Spurs a point at Monaco
item.description: Tottenham Hotspur keeper Guglielmo Vicario makes a catalogue of saves to deny Monaco their first Champions League win of the season, as Thomas Frank's side earn a 0-0 draw at the Stade Louis-II.

item.title: Bellingham gets first goal of season as Real see off Juventus
item.description: Jude Bellingham's first goal of the season is enough to give Real Madrid a 1-0 win over Juventus at the Santiago Bernabeu in the league phase of the Champions League.

item.title: Teenager Karl scores brilliant goal as Bayern thrash Club Brugge
item.description: Lennart Karl becomes the youngest player to score for Bayern Munich in the Champions League, at 17 years and 242 days, as the German champions hammer Club Brugge 4-0 at the Allianz Arena.

item.title: Ekitike sparks Liverpool comeback against Eintracht Frankfurt
item.description: Liverpool hit Eintracht Frankfurt on the counter as Hugo Ekitike runs through to score against his former club, to bring the English champions level against the German side at the Deutsche Bank Park in the Champions League.

item.title: Sporting score late to seal comeback win over 10-man Marseille
item.description: Alisson Santos' curling effort in the 86th minute gives Sporting victory over 10-man Marseille side at the Estadio JosÃ© Alvalade in the Champions League.

item.title: Sutton's predictions v The Charlatans guitarist Mark Collins
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on The Charlatans guitarist Mark Collins with his predictions for this weekend's Premier League fixtures.

item.title: Bronze wins England award after Euros heroics
item.description: Lucy Bronze says she puts her "heart and soul" into every game after being named the England Women's Player of the Year for 2024-25.

item.title: Why Messi's MLS legacy needs play-off triumph as he signs new deal
item.description: Inter Miami are hoping Lionel Messi can inspire them to a first MLS Cup win through the play-offs and cement his legacy in the league.

item.title: Man City cult hero keeper Carson retires at 40
item.description: Former Manchester City goalkeeper Scott Carson has been described as a "legend" and "The Goat" after announcing his retirement aged 40.

item.title: Kane can't stop scoring - is the Ballon d'Or within reach?
item.description: With 23 goals in 15 games for Bayern Munich and England this season, Harry Kane is emerging as an early frontrunner for the 2026 Ballon d'Or.

item.title: I nearly quit football for basketball - Gvardiol
item.description: Josko Gvardiol reveals he nearly quit his "dream" career in football when he was a teenager struggling to break through at Dinamo Zagreb.

item.title: Triple up on Bournemouth v Forest - FPL team of the week
item.description: There's a Bournemouth triple-up in this week's Fantasy Premier League team of the week as the Cherries look to take advantage of a Nottingham Forest side in disarray.

item.title: Slot reveals Isak fitness worry
item.description: Liverpool boss Arne Slot reveals he withdrew Alexander Isak at half-time against Eintracht Frankfurt because the striker had felt discomfort in his groin.

item.title: Gyokeres at the double as Arsenal thrash Atletico
item.description: Viktor Gyokeres scores his first Champions League goals for Arsenal as the Premier League side dominate Atletico Madrid 4-0 at Emirates Stadium.

item.title: Barnes scores twice as Newcastle beat Mourinho's Benfica
item.description: A second-half double from Harvey Barnes helps Newcastle secure a 3-0 win over Jose Mourinho's Benfica at St James' Park in the Champions League.

item.title: Haaland scores in 12th consecutive game as Man City see off Villarreal
item.description: Erling Haaland finds the net for a 12th consecutive game to maintain his incredible goalscoring streak and help Manchester City end their winless away run in the Champions League with victory at Villarreal.

item.title: How change in system gave Liverpool 'more control' against Frankfurt
item.description: BBC Sport pundit Stephen Warnock explains how Liverpool adopting a 4-4-2 formation against Eintracht Frankfurt enabled Arne Slot to get his high profile attacking players into the squad, but warns it could lead to the Premier League champions being vulnerable in midfield without the right personnel.

item.title: How Newcastle's 'brilliant' press 'smothered' Benfica
item.description: Champions League analyst Stephen Warnock praises Newcastle United's "bravery" to play a high line and press from the front in their 3-0 win over Benfica.

item.title: Osimhen double gives Galatasaray comfortable win over Bodo/Glimt
item.description: A first-half double from Victor Osimhen helps Galatasary overcome Bodo/Glimt 3-1 RAMS Park in the Champions League.

item.title: Guruzeta double helps Athletic Club to win over Qarabag
item.description: Gorka Guruzeta scores twice to give Athletic Club a comeback 3-1 win over Qarabag and their first points of this season's league phase of the UEFA Champions League.

item.title: Fabulous Lopez hat-trick gives Barca comfortable win
item.description: Fermin Lopez hits a hat-trick, with Marcus Rashford scoring twice, as Barcelona thrash 10-man Olympiacos 6-1 in the league phase of the Champions League.

item.title: What makes Gyokeres unique? Ex-Man Utd striker Cole explains
item.description: Andy Cole and Guillem Balague analyse how Viktor Gyokeres' ability to run the channels allows his Arsenal team-mates to get involved in play after the Sweden striker scored twice in the 4-0 win over Atletico Madrid.

item.title: Vote for your BBC Women's Footballer of the Year
item.description: Voting for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2025 award is now open.

item.title: Women's Footballer of the Year contender Hampton
item.description: BBC Sport profiles Chelsea and England goalkeeper Hannah Hampton, one of five nominees for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2025 award.

item.title: Women's Footballer of the Year contender Bonmati
item.description: BBC Sport profiles Barcelona and Spain midfielder Aitana Bonmati, one of five nominees for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2025 award.

item.title: Women's Footballer of the Year contender Caldentey
item.description: BBC Sport profiles Arsenal and Spain midfielder Mariona Caldentey, one of five nominees for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2025 award.

item.title: Women's Footballer of the Year contender Russo
item.description: BBC Sport profiles Arsenal and England forward Alessia Russo, one of five nominees for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2025 award.

item.title: Women's Footballer of the Year contender Guijarro
item.description: BBC Sport profiles Barcelona and Spain midfielder Patri Guijarro, one of five nominees for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2025 award.

item.title: 2025 BBC Women's Footballer of the Year contenders
item.description: Meet the five contenders who have been nominated for the 2025 BBC Women's Footballer of the Year award.

item.title: Inter thrash USG to maintain 100% start
item.description: Inter Milan continue their perfect start to the league phase of the Champions League with a 4-0 win at Union Saint-Gilloise.

item.title: PSG dominate Leverkusen in fiery encounter
item.description: Defending champions Paris-St Germain thump Bayer Leverkusen 7-2 as both teams finish with 10 men in the league phase of the Champions League.

item.title: Bellingham stars as Dortmund cruise to win at Copenhagen
item.description: Jobe Bellingham makes his first goal contribution for Borussia Dortmund, providing an assist as the German side beat Copenhagen 4-2 at Parken Stadium.

item.title: PSV stun Napoli with incredible comeback win
item.description: PSV Eindhoven recover from a goal down to complete a dominant 6-2 win over Napoli in the league phase of the Champions League, as the Italian champions finish the game with 10 men.

item.title: Ten-man Pafos hold on to secure point away to Kairat
item.description: Despite a Joao Correia red card in the fourth minute, 10-man Pafos manage to hold on for a 0-0 draw at Kazakh champions Kairat Almaty in the Champions League.

item.title: Why are the top strikers scoring more goals in modern football?
item.description: Champions League pundit Guillem Balague believes with more teams playing man-to-man marking strikers in modern football are awarded more space to score goals and are also being given "individualised coaching" about how to exploit those spaces.

item.title: Wasteful Atalanta held to goalless draw by Slavia Prague
item.description: Atalanta take 22 shots but fail to convert any of them into goals as a resilient Slavia Prague side leave Bergamo with a 0-0 draw, in the league phase of the UEFA Champions League.

item.title: Lincoln City fined over 'sectarian chants' at Wrexham's McClean
item.description: The FA said Wrexham's James McClean was the target of "sectarian chanting" during a match in May.

item.title: Newcastle explore bringing Anderson back - Thursday's gossip
item.description: Newcastle United explore bringing Elliot Anderson back to club, Bayern Munich chief says no release clause in Michael Olise contract, Harry Maguire yet to be offered new deal by Manchester United, plus more.

item.title: Nolan's plan to end 'them and us' with referees
item.description: Northampton boss Kevin Nolan calls for referees to join club training sessions to break down the 'them and us' relationship with players.

item.title: Walsh makes Chelsea history on night of records for youthful Blues
item.description: Reggie Walsh, 17, became the second youngest Englishman to play in the Champions League and the youngest Chelsea player to play in Europe's elite competition on Wednesday.

item.title: Spurs ride luck in Monaco but fans deliver verdict on dismal show
item.description: Spurs rode their luck to earn a Champions League point in Monaco - but no-one will fear them on this evidence says chief football writer Phil McNulty

item.title: 'The bit I like is when you win' - Dyche on football's fashionistas
item.description: "I have seen enough fashionistas come in and out of this division," says new Nottingham Forest manager Sean Dyche.

item.title: Players not paying attention to outside noise - Hayes
item.description: Republic of Ireland defender Caitlin Hayes says that players are focusing on their Nations League promotion/relegation play-off against Belgium and not issues surrounding the Football Association Ireland [FAI].

item.title: Hearts facing 'toughest challenge' - McInnes
item.description: Scottish Premiership leaders Hearts face "the toughest challenge" against defending champions Celtic on Sunday, says boss Derek McInnes.

item.title: Villarreal shown 'lack of respect' over cancelled Miami game
item.description: Villarreal say they have been shown "a complete and utter lack of respect" by La Liga over the cancellation of their overseas match against Barcelona in the United States.

item.title: What is Baller League & who is playing and managing?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain what the Baller League is and who the managers and players are.

item.title: 'Being gay didn't feel normal, until I became a footballer'
item.description: Manchester City's Kerstin Casparij always knew she "fancied girls" but did not see LGBTQ+ representation until playing professional football.

item.title: 'I won't throw anyone under the bus' - Swans boss Sheehan
item.description: Alan Sheehan refuses to single out players for blame despite Malick Yalcouye's red card in the defeat by Queen's Park Rangers.

item.title: Why Gyokeres offers more than just goals to Arsenal
item.description: Boss Mikel Arteta says Viktor Gyokeres makes Arsenal a "much better team" - BBC Sport looks at what the forward brings to the Gunners.

item.title: Tottenham's Naz replaces Park in England squad
item.description: Tottenham forward Jess Naz is added to the England squad for the friendlies with Brazil and Australia after Jess Park withdrew because of injury.

item.title: Is Dyche the right man to repair Forest?
item.description: Sean Dyche answers an SOS call from Nottingham Forest as the club look to restore confidence - is he the right man for the job?

item.title: The evolution of Rice - how midfielder became Arsenal's all-rounder
item.description: Since the arrival of Martin Zubimendi at Arsenal, BBC Sport looks at how Declan Rice has completed his transformation to an all-round midfielder.

item.title: Amorim's big moment - are Man Utd finally ready for lift off?
item.description: Finally, at Anfield, home of Manchester United's - historically and statistically - biggest rivals, Ruben Amorim's team delivered a statement win.

item.title: 'Managing a lot of Premier League teams like a holiday compared to Celtic'
item.description: Brendan Rodgers sits down with Kelly Somers to discuss his managerial career, proudest moment and joining the 1,000 club.

item.title: Football, fashion & the rise of the replica shirt
item.description: How football shirts have evolved from one kit per club per season, with simple designs, to fashion statements.

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: What is the Premier League multi-ball system?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at the rules of the Premier League multi-ball system and what happened in Liverpool's defeat against Manchester United.

item.title: When is the 2027 Women's World Cup qualification draw?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains when the 2027 Women's World Cup European qualification draw takes place and how it works?

item.title: When did a non-Old Firm team last win a Scottish title?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at the last time a team other than Rangers or Celtic won Scottish football's top flight division.

item.title: How did internet outage affect West Ham v Brentford?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why the Amazon Web Services global outage affected Brentford's win over West Ham

item.title: What is the manager VAR card being trialled by Fifa?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything Team look at how the Football Video Support system works.

item.title: What does squad-cost ratio and anchoring mean in football?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain what squad-cost ratio and anchoring mean.

item.title: England are going to the 2026 World Cup - who else has qualified?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at who has qualified for next year's Fifa World Cup.

item.title: Rangers 'didn't screw up' head coach appointment
item.description: Chairman Andrew Cavenagh insists Rangers did not "screw up" the process to appoint head coach Danny Rohl but admits it looked "clunky" from the outside.

item.title: What did we learn from Rohl's Rangers unveiling?
item.description: Danny Rohl understands the need to win quickly as Rangers head coach and says he can handle pressure, as chief executive Patrick Stewart and sporting director Kevin Thelwell come under fire.

item.title: Winning & togetherness - Rohl sets out Rangers mission
item.description: Danny Rohl delivers a simple message as he is introduced as Rangers head coach, stating: "We want to win."

item.title: 'Rohl jumps from Wednesday frying pan into Rangers furnace'
item.description: Danny Rohl has taken on one of the toughest managerial jobs in world football by succeeding Russell Martin at Rangers, writes Tom English.

item.title: 'A proud club dragged into gutter'
item.description: Kevin Muscat is the latest to be ruled out of Rangers' manager search - so what do fans make of the process, and who do they want now?

item.title: Watch live Bundesliga games on Friday nights on the BBC
item.description: BBC Sport announce broadcasting rights for Bundesliga matches for the 2025-26 and 2026-27 seasons.

item.title: 'With service, Hojlund is a 25-goals-a-year striker'
item.description: Peter Schmeichel criticises the decision-making at Manchester United that has allowed Rasmus Hojlund to follow Scott McTominay to Napoli.

item.title: Agyemang joins Premier League stars on Golden award shortlists
item.description: England striker Michelle Agyemang is nominated for Golden Girl, while nine Premier League players are named on the shortlist for the Golden Boy award.

item.title: Top European clubs discuss using six substitutes
item.description: Europe's top clubs, including some Premier League sides, have held discussions about using six substitutes per game to ease the workload on players.

item.title: Overseas game a 'sacrifice' for 'survival' of Serie A - Como
item.description: Italian club Como say "sacrifice is essential" to ensure the "survival" of Serie A amid the financial dominance of the Premier League as they press ahead with plans to play AC Milan in Perth, Australia.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.

item.title: The rise and fall of North Korea - the sleeping giant of women's football
item.description: North Korea lags behind most of the rest of the world in several areas. But the hermit state has had an outsized impact on international women's football.
